metadata.titel_preek: Sermon 34: A Prayer to the Holy Spirit

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Holy Spirit (Subject) takes possession of the soul (Object) to restore it to its original innocence and lead it to eternal life, despite the soul's total incompetence.

tekstueel_bewijs: take my place and speak to yourself about yourself

object.identificatie: The Soul / Salvation / Possession of God
tekstueel_bewijs: so that I may become your property
delight in you for all eternity
Your mercy is what inspires me to speak
you are both teacher and knowledge
may your miserable creature not incur your wrath

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / The Enemy / The Seven Vices
tekstueel_bewijs: swelling of my pride, clear the rot of my anger
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is depicted as a violent external force that 'beats and wounds' and 'evicts' God, requiring a divine counter-invasion.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The soul (Subject) responds to the Spirit by consecrating its powers and renouncing the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Soul / Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly framed as a 'result' of the primary divine action ('As a result... you will find a dwelling in good condition').

voorbeelden_god_subject: You must, therefore, give yourself to me
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I want to speak about you
I will trust in your mercy

voorbeelden: You must, therefore, give yourself to me (Note: This is a 'must' of divine nature, not human law)
today I understand how miserable I am
without your help I cannot say a single thing
You can forgive hundreds of thousands of sins
help which can assist you so mightily

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is centered on human impotence (ne-pas-pouvoir) and divine omnipotence (pouvoir-faire). The 'must' is directed at God's own character, not the hearer's performance.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the fear of S2 (Justice) through the recognition of ~S1 (Sin), moving to ~S2 (Leniency) and finally resting in S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'consubstantiality' of God and Mercy, making S1 the dominant reality.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'horrific torments' and 'mortal sin' are presented as real possibilities that only Grace can avert.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor even in the act of the preacher speaking. Human action is framed as a response to divine initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: O my sinful soul, get up, stand straight

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: take my place and speak to yourself about yourself
if you save us, it is not because we have performed righteous deeds, but because you are merciful

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used, but specifically as trophies of grace rather than models of virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The text already provides the theocentric reading: 'how you inspired all these people'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and total dependence on the Spirit.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification; the Spirit is the 'only person you need for that task'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Spirit's work to the soul's response is logically and theologically integrated through the metaphor of the 'dwelling'.
spanning_punten: The command to the soul to 'get up' vs the prayer for the Spirit to 'help me get up'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In possessing your mercy, I possess you.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the soul lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Extremely high; sin is 'rot', 'infection', and 'malice' that leaves the soul 'half-dead'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The hearer is positioned as a beggar/receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation well.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent is already depicted as a lethal force.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It avoids the trap of exemplarism by focusing on God's action in the lives of saints rather than their own willpower.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'I' and 'You' dialogue; Greimas reveals that the 'I' is actually a passive Receiver of the 'You's' Subject-action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the Lukan or Pauline context; Greimas looks at the functional engine of the sermon's own internal story.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that even when the preacher says 'I will trust', the preceding actants establish that this trust is a 'gift' and 'inspiration' from the Sender, not a self-generated work.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Axis of Desire' to pull the hearer into God's own desire for the soul.
